intro: Oreogrammitis crinifera, commonly known as the feather moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores when mature. Oreogrammitis crinifera plays an important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
